title: Invalid sha256 hash when downloading and installing latest nightly
body:
I wanted to update my `rustc` and `cargo` with the latest releases to check out the newest changes. I used the `rustup.sh` script to do this. However after downloading the `.tar.gz` and the `.sha256`, they don't match up:

```
rustup: Downloading https://static.rust-lang.org/dist/rust-nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu.tar.gz to /tmp/somedir/rust.tar.gz
  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
100  115M  100  115M    0     0  3180k      0  0:00:37  0:00:37 --:--:-- 3511k
rustup: Downloading https://static.rust-lang.org/dist/rust-nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu.tar.gz.sha256
  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
100   111  100   111    0     0   2634      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:--  2642
rustup: Verifying hash
rustup: error: invalid sha256.
 078ed01cef6b42919946c0733bbaac641c02e22832fa4f4ff4590cedb6b76410   https://static.rust-lang.org/dist/rust-nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu.tar.gz
 45766b1247dea58e8e6b48666f90637e1208615edbe7a5c2e0d45609f4bf1475   /tmp/somedir/rust.tar.gz
```
